author: jrie
Description: Canvas Lister Guide, please see the notes for the different versions

General features.Pagination: Click the canvas to activate navigation using the arrow keys, implemented in the pagination version
General features.Canvas resize: Left clicking the canvas, then to enlarge or shrink the canvas/read area width, use plus or minus on the numpad

Using guide.General: The lister can be added by calling "canvasLister(canvasItemId, sourceFile, fontDefaultFamily, fontDefaultSize, fontDefaultWeight, fontDefaultShape, backgroundColor, fontDefaultColor, none\null\sourceText);
Using guide.cavansElement: Defines which canvas element id we want to display markup information on
Using guide.sourceFile: References the source file from which our textmarkup is loaded from, this is loaded using Ajax, set to null, if you want to to provide a string using the "text" parameter
Using guide.font: Which font-family, by default, should be used to display text. In example: "Helvetica", defaults to sans-serif if set to null
Using guide.size: Which font size in pixels to use for general text, in example "16px", defaults to 12px if set to null
Using guide.weight: Default text weight, "normal" by default if set to null, possible values are "bold" or any other weigth provided by a canvas item
Using guide.textAlignment: Defaults to "left" but can be set to "justified" to justify the text, if set to null default to "left"
Using guide.bg: Hex value for the canvas background, defaults to white/#ffffff if set to null
Using guide.fg: Hex value for the text color to use if not defined otherwise, defaults to black/#000000 if set to null
Using guide.sourceText: Tested working - if the text is provided, and the sourceFile parameter is set to zero, we get our text information via the string provided here; this can include markup
Using guide.usePaging: If any element like text would overflow the canvas in height, we start using pagination, the implementation started in the "canvas_phantom_pagination.js" version
Using guide.pagingHeight: Not implemented yet - Height in pixels or percentage on which the text should overflow into a new page

Syntax/tag elements.General Information: All of the following elements have custom attributes and different ways to display or format them, please refer to the Elements section for details
Syntax/tag elements.text: Everything which is not declared otherwise is threaded as text, but which can be formatted using style tags
Syntax/tag elements.img: Basic implementation in 'canvaslister_phantom_image' started, not yet completed - - Defines an image using "" which should be displayed at this location, inside or outside of the text, has addional options, doesnt have a closing tag!
Syntax/tag elements.video: Not implemented yet - <video> - defines a video entry which should be displayed, similar to an img element and might requrie additional parameter to work

Elements.General: Text tags should be enclosing the text, imgs arent enclosed
Elements.Example: Regular text and <b color="#00AA00" size="140%">bolded text, in green, displayed in 140% percent size of the base text size</>

text.Example: <b color="#00AA00" size="14px">Test in green 14 pixels<color="#AA0000" size="16px">16 px height text</></>
text.Defined by: An example text. With <i>italic</> formatting or both <bi>bold italic</> or <size="14px">Size in pixel</>
text.color: color="#FF0000" - tells the color of the text should be red, provided in a hex value, defaults to black/#000000
text.i: Tells the text should be shown in italic, example <i>Italic text<i>
text.b: If given, the text is shown in bold, which also equal "font-weight: bold", in example <b>Im bold text</>
text.bi: If present, the text is shown in bold and italic - example <bi> bold italic text</>
text.font: Not implemented yet - the name of the font family to use for this font, defaults to what has been provided in the main parameter

img.General: Feature not yet implemented, to be done

text.title: This is the title/hover text provided by an image
text.description: This text is shown as a description text for the image, it can be configured where it should be displayed using a simple syntax
text.height: The height of the image in pixel - required as no automated detection for resizing can be done at the moment
text.width: The width of the image in pixel - required
text.src: the src url of the image, this is required, please note that there is no check if the src url is valid or not
text.align: Left/Center/Right - should the image be aligned on the left, center or right, defaults to center, left aligned images float on the same virtual space
text.margin: Spacing around the image and its description
text.fg: Foreground color for the image description box as hex
text.bg: Background color for the image description box as hex
text.box: Defaults to "under" - no other options yet in planning, margin is calculated outside the image descripion box
text.textflow: Not implemented yet - None/Left/Right - defines if text should flow around an the image, defaults to None, meaning the image is shown in its own horizontal space separated from text and markup
